(a) Fully implement the pre-requisite controls from the risk assessment identified in the permit to work system
(b) Identify the need for danger and caution notices and the application of them within the Electrical Work Plan
(c) Ensure the role and competency of a standby person required for work on high voltage electrical equipment was authorised in accordance with your Electrical Safety Rules
(d) Adequately audit, monitor and review the permit to work system to ensure that the Electrical Safety Rules were being adhered to
and, on the 15th August 2021, an electrical technician sustained a burn injury to their right hand when he opened the incorrect 3.3KV switchboard rear cover for maintenance purposes, resulting in an electrical arc flash event.
